title: Frou-frou - Etymology, Origin & Meaning
text: Advertisement Want to remove ads? Log in to see fewer ads, and become a Premium Member to remove all ads. Origin and history of frou-frou frou-frou(n.) 1870, "a rustling," from French (19c.), possibly imitative of the rustling of a dress. The word was popularized in English by a French play translated and given that name. Meaning "fussy details" is from 1876. Entries linking to frou-frou Advertisement Want to remove ads?
